data.title: Chartered Institution of Railway Operators
data.text:
CIRO Academic Scholarship – Higher Education access for all.

Are you passionate about progressing your career in Railway Operations Management but facing financial barriers?

CIRO are offering a minimum of 2 fully funded places on our Certificate level academic programme for the 2024 intake to students from socioeconomically challenged backgrounds.

Learn More

Applications are Open for CIRO Academic Programs

Are you ready to take your career to the next level and develop valuable skills and knowledge?

Our higher education programmes can equip you with the knowledge and expertise you need to succeed in the railway industry. We offer programmes to suit all experience levels, through Certificate, Diploma and Degree courses.

Find out more today!

Learn More

Founded in 1999, the Institution of Railway Operators was created to work at the heart of the rail operations community. We are the only professional institution whose focus and specialism are railway operations.

In 2020, the Institution was recognised by Her Majesty the Queen by the granting of a Royal Charter for its work within the industry. It then became the Chartered Institution of Railway Operators (CIRO).

CIRO offers a combination of learning from our Introduction to Rail course to a Degree in Railway Operations Managements, events, CPD courses, and networking opportunities for current and aspiring rail employees. CIRO also offers a unique Mentoring Scheme where the expertise of industry leaders is shared to support our members. This helps in delivering the very best developmental opportunities and industry-recognised qualifications for the next generation of the rail industry.

We are proud to bring positive changes and improvements to the industry by working alongside members and rail operations businesses.

The courses with CIRO are great because you don’t get all of this knowledge in one place anywhere else. It plugs the gaps in your knowledge base, plus there’s the non-academic side which is also great like the events, speakers, webinars and more, they’re very valuable. It gives students a route to an academic qualification that they might not otherwise have.

Former CIRO graduate and current CIRO tutor Toby Rackliff
